channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.title: 4 streetlights permanently not working, 8th September
item.description:
Street light corner of The Reddings and Grovefield Way, plus 3 street lights opposite or near Maytree Villa, Grovefield Way, GL51 6DP. Area is so dark need to use torch/light on phone when walking aloing that section of pavement

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Grovefield Way, Hatherley, Cheltenham

item.title: Huge tree that needs pollarding, 8th September
item.description:
Large tree at the rear of 180 Elmleaze on council land. This tree needs pollarding etc. as the branches overhang my garage and drive. A sticky resin falls on my car in the summer and when the seeds and leaves fall, the ground gets slippery and the garage gutters get blocked and overflow. (Dangerous situation for two 75 year olds) The road gutters get blocked causing flooding sometimes and the bus's constantly hit the overhanging branches. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmleaze, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple potholes on dunster road, 7th September
item.description:
The location is where Wentworth Road joins into Dunster Road with multiple deep potholes affecting cars noticeable to walkers by. The road needs to be taken its surface right down and relaid. Of interest to the council re people claiming damage to vehicles. I cannot measure them but they are all varied and also dangerous as a trip hazard for those crossing the road especially the elderly.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Dunster Road, Springbank, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Red barriers still on fence, 7th September
item.description:
Hi these red barriers were placed here in January due to a reported sunk pavement. Please can I have an update as to what is currently being investigated? Can the reason for the pavement issues be confirmed. If there is a fault with the pavement does a new ticket need to be raised? These barriers seem to be left here with no future work happening. Do they need to be removed?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Great Western Terrace, Alstone, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
